form_title.ms_form_title_llm_v1: YOH HAN LEE, File A17 182 973, In re: YOH HAN LEE, File A17 182 973

full_text: Screened by NARA, 8/18/2023 Q. & A. statement by YOH HAN LEE (Cont'd.) In re: YOH HAN LEE, File A17 182 973 Q. Did you explain to the American Consulate in Rio de Janeiro that you had been denied an immigrant visa by the American Consulate in Sao Paulo the previous month? NOTE: Attorney has objected to alien's answer to question asked by Immigrant Inspector. Q. As your attorney has objected to that question, did you inform the American Consulate that you had applied for an immigrant visa at the American Consulate in Sao Paulo, Brazil? A. I didn't inform the Consulate in Rio de Janiero. We were plann- ing as temporary tourists as I told you, because we had to catch up the time for FOIA (b)(6) Q. Now Sir, I wish to call to your attention bring to your attention, that on your application for your visitor's visa at Sao Paulo, Brazil you informed in your application on Item # 26, that you had never applied for an immigrant visa and that you had never applied for a visitor's visa and you also by your application indicated that you had been a resident of Sao Paulo for five years and that you also indicated that you were coming to the United States to visit friends or relatives in Portland, Oregon. Now is this correct Sir? NOTE: Lawyer views evidence in question Q. Now Mr. Bonapart have you thoroughly viewed the evidence in question? ATT'Y. I have. Q. Now I will reask the question, Mr. Lee and state again that is a matter of record that when you needed your application for your visitor's visa at Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, you stated on your application on Item # 26 that you had not applied for an immigrant visa to enter the United States before and Item # 24, you had not applied for a visitor's visa to the United States before and you also indicated on # 28 that you had been a resident of Rio de Janeiro for approximately the last five years. will you explain Sir why you made these allegations on this application for your visitor's visa? A. I feel that the tourist application cane up very suddenly and we thought that we couldn't get the tourist visa and I put the answer on that the resident I was a resident in Rio but not so many years as we went in Sao Paulo, and I realize that didn't mean very much to the Consulate approval as a tourist. The main point is if we can get the tourist visa and certainly we were, by the law as, a tourist, and I can realize that I didn't realize that the -5-
